locations.name: Waterdeep
locations.description: The City of Splendors, a bustling metropolis and one of the greatest cities in Faerûn. Located on the Sword Coast, it is the most influential city in the North.
locations.localGovernment: The Lords of Waterdeep (Masked Lords) and the Open Lord

locations.name: Mirabar
locations.description: A mining city known for its skilled metalworkers and gem cutters. The city is built into the side of the mountain and is famous for its dwarven craftsmanship.

locations.name: Longsaddle
locations.description: A small town famous for the Harpell family of wizards. The town is known for its magical experiments and eccentric inhabitants.

locations.name: Amphail
locations.description: A small but prosperous town known for horse breeding and training. The town is famous for its annual horse fair and the quality of its steeds.

locations.name: Daggerford
locations.description: A fortified town that guards an important crossing of the Trade Way. The town is known for its strategic location and strong defenses.

locations.name: Candlekeep
locations.description: A fortress library containing the largest collection of books and scrolls in Faerûn. The keep is protected by powerful magic and dedicated scholars.
locations.significance: The greatest repository of knowledge in Faerûn
locations.history: Founded in the Year of the Watching Cold (241 DR) by the great sage Alaundo, Candlekeep has stood as a bastion of knowledge for centuries.
locations.visitingHours: Dawn to Dusk, by appointment only

locations.name: The Sword Mountains
locations.description: A mountain range home to various monsters and several dwarven strongholds. The mountains are rich in minerals and dangerous creatures.
locations.significance: Major geographical feature and source of valuable minerals
locations.history: The mountains have been home to dwarven clans for millennia, though many of their halls have fallen to monsters and orcs.

locations.name: High Forest
locations.description: An ancient forest realm, one of the largest forests in Faerûn. The forest is home to many elven communities and magical creatures.
locations.significance: One of the last great elven realms in Faerûn
locations.history: The forest has stood since the dawn of time, growing and evolving with the world itself. It has been a refuge for elves and other magical beings for millennia.

locations.name: Neverwinter Woods
locations.description: A dense forest region known for its ancient trees and magical creatures. The wood is home to many druids and fey creatures.
locations.significance: Major natural resource and magical site
locations.history: The forest has existed since the dawn of time, growing and evolving with the world itself. Its ancient trees are said to hold memories of the world's earliest days.

locations.name: Thornhold
locations.description: Thornhold, also known as Stoneshaft Hold among its dwarven residents, was a fortress located off the southern edge of the Mere of Dead Men.
locations.access: By invitation or official business only

locations.name: Helm's Hold
locations.description: Helm's Hold was a fortified city and cathedral dedicated to Helm found on the Sword Coast North. It serves as a major religious center and defensive outpost.

locations.name: Baldur's Gate
locations.description: Baldur's Gate, the Halfway to Everywhere, the City of Blood, also simply called the Gate, was one of the largest metropolises and city-states on the Sword Coast.

locations.name: Red Larch
locations.description: The town of Red Larch was a waystop on the Long Road seven days north of Waterdeep, and was located at the intersection of three trails.

locations.name: The Golden Fields
locations.description: Goldenfields, nicknamed the Granary of the North, was a walled abbey to Chauntea of spectacular scope and size. It was the most prolific provider of crops, grains and fruits to the people of the North.

locations.name: Neverwinter City
locations.description: The City of Skilled Hands, Neverwinter is known for its skilled craftspeople and beautiful architecture. The city has recovered from the Spellplague and is once again a thriving metropolis.

locations.name: Luskan City
locations.description: Luskan, also known as the City of Sails, was a port city at the mouth of the River Mirar on the Sword Coast North. Despite its troubled past, it remains an important trading port.

locations.name: Blacklake District
locations.description: A wealthy and influential district in Neverwinter, known for its noble estates and the mysterious Blacklake itself.
locations.significance: Center of political and economic power in Neverwinter
locations.history: The district was established during Neverwinter's early history and has been home to the city's elite for centuries.

locations.name: The Chasm
locations.description: A massive rift that split the city during the Spellplague, now a source of danger and dark rumors.
locations.history: Created during the Spellplague, the Chasm has been a source of both danger and opportunity for the city.

locations.name: Protector's Enclave
locations.description: The heart of Neverwinter's government and commerce, bustling with markets, guards, and adventurers.

locations.name: Tower District
locations.description: Once a center of arcane study, now a ruined area haunted by monsters and the remnants of magical disasters.

locations.name: Neverdeath Graveyard
locations.description: The city's ancient graveyard, shrouded in mist and tales of restless spirits.
locations.history: The graveyard has been the final resting place for Neverwinter's citizens for centuries, with some graves dating back to the city's founding.
